file_content.text: Good work at CZ-198. Back to cataloging Czerka's attic space, I suppose.
So you made it out of CZ-198 in one piece. And with perfect timing. The Chancellor's signal just came through.
Master Jedi. Again, you prove yourself to be an indispensable defender of the Republic.
Impeccable work, Major, though I've come to expect nothing less from Havoc Squad.
Once again I ask for your services, Captain, and once again I have nothing but praise for the results.
I thank you all for your service. The Republic needs its most dedicated, loyal citizens to defend it.
I already have a team preparing to sweep CZ-198 and secure the facility.
Czerka was doing more than research at CZ-198. It created an alien creature as its security system: the Vigilant.
Czerka made a monster there.
This is all the information recovered on the creature, Chancellor.
This is monstrous even for Czerka. And we've gone easy on them?
Tell the team to be careful. Rasmus Blys didn't release his workforce during the lockdown, and there are still innocent people at CZ-198.
There are workers inside.
There's other reasons for the team to be careful, Chancellor: the Vigilant. Look at this.
CZ-198 has entire rooms of prototype technology and research data, just waiting for someone to claim them.
It's a treasure trove.
I'm sending a preliminary report and inventory now, Chancellor.
CZ-198 had... a living security system? Genetically engineered? We've been far, far too lenient on Czerka.
I recommend we arrest Czerka's chief executives. We need to interrogate them regarding the Vigilant, and whatever else they're hiding.
You just assume every Czerka official is a criminal? This Vigilant creature was made at a closed facility. You can't blame us all for Rasmus Blys's mistakes.
We should be better than Czerka, Chancellor. If we want to learn about the Vigilant, we have full access to the labs at CZ-198.
I agree. No interrogations.
Very well. But tell your colleagues, Executive Laphmer: If they have any confessions to make, now is the time.
I'll remind them, Supreme Chancellor, of course.
The Vigilant was only the latest horror that Czerka Corporation created. It's about time someone was punished for its crimes.
Someone must answer for this.
This isn't right! What happened to Republic justice?
It protects those Republic citizens who obey the law, Executive Laphmer.
CZ-198 will be assessed, and its technology reclaimed. My thanks again. I suspect we'll soon be putting Czerka's technology to good use.
Rasmus Blys, the Vigilant... what's going on at CZ-198?
Reconsider, adjudicator. This information is worth at least one mansion on Alsakan! Adjudicator!
My apology on Executive Laphmer's behalf, Master Jedi. I'm Adjudicator Refain; we're... renegotiating.
Excuse the noise, Major, Executive Laphmer has a number of... grievances. Adjudicator Refain.
Please excuse Executive Laphmer, Captain, he's rather upset. I'm Adjudicator Refain.
You'll have to excuse Executive Laphmer's manners, and... volume. I'm Adjudicator Refain.
I'm handling the Republic takeover of Czerka Corporation, of which Master Laphmer is--was--a senior executive.
Czerka's collapsing under scandals, financial crises and lost factories. Fortunately, the Republic's been authorized to seize Czerka's assets.
I haven't been following the HoloNet news. What is Czerka Corporation?
Explain Czerka to me.
For centuries, we were an industry leader in droid and weapons manufacture. Now we're being picked clean.
Czerka Corporation had a lot of wealth and power. What changed that the company collapsed so quickly?
What happened to Czerka?
Immoral idiots destroyed our Tatooine operations. Then we lost a fortune during the war, along with key executives.
Full access to Czerka Corporation's labs and vaults. You must have recovered quite the haul.
What assets have you claimed?
Prototype hardware and rare bio materials--that's just the appetizer.
Czerka's cooperating with the seizure. But one of its facilities, CZ-198, rebelled and entered lockdown. No one in or out, no communications.
Executive Laphmer is offering information about CZ-198's security, but he's demanding a mansion and a lifetime salary in exchange.
What about an apartment on Coruscant and a nice safe, bureaucratic job? It's more than most Republic citizens get.
Scale those demands down.
An apartment on Coruscant. This is what I've been reduced to.
Adjudicator, you can't expect a Czerka executive to have realistic demands. We need that data on CZ-198 now.
Time's short. We agree.
Fine, done. It's not like our negotiations have got anywhere.
You will give that datapad to Adjudicator Refain.
[Force Persuade] Hand it over.
I'll give the datapad to Adjudicator Refain.
Well, I--thank you. Let's take a look.
Trust me, Laphmer, there are worse things than losing your wealth.
Here's my offer. [Punch him]
Hmph. Such as?
Interesting negotiating tactics you have.
This is... CZ-198 is a level ten research facility. All of Czerka's top secret data. Classified research projects, banned weaponry....
And, of course it's all protected. By a prototype security system, called "the Vigilant."
Czerka can use any security system it likes, but whatever's hidden at CZ-198 will be brought to light.
Czerka can't hide behind it.
If this "Vigilant" is protecting such a high-level facility, Czerka will have spared no expense perfecting it. We should be cautious.
That system will be trouble.
With that level of secrecy, I'm guessing CZ-198's bosses won't have let the workers slip through the lockdown.
There'll be civilians inside.
Of course not, that's standard procedure for our--I mean, their, facilities.
They can give it a fancy name, but every system's got a workaround somewhere.
Security system? No worries.
Just what kind of security system is the Vigilant? That doesn't sound like a Czerka product.
What is this Vigilant?
The datapad only says that it's a last-ditch emergency measure.
I'm willing to bet CZ-198 will have plenty of tricks up its sleeve, besides this "Vigilant."
And likely other defenses too.
CZ-198 has some of Czerka's oldest, darkest secrets. Forget asset seizure, CZ-198's a genuine threat.
I need someone I can trust to breach CZ-198's defenses, seize whatever projects are there, and ensure the Vigilant stays offline. Can you do that?
Count on me. I'd like to see what Czerka Corporation considers "top secret."
Yes, I can.
Just tell me where to find this facility and it'll be done.
Where is CZ-198?
It's a private moon--off the charts, naturally, but this datapad has all the details.
If I go up against the Vigilant and whatever else Czerka's been hiding, I hope the Republic plans to share its windfall.
If the reward is right.
So long as CZ-198 is secured.
One last thing. The overseer at CZ-198 is Special Executive Rasmus Blys. This performance review calls him "dynamic and energetic."
Translation from Czerka-speak: absolutely ruthless. The Vigilant may be the least of your concerns.
One minute, this Czerka executive's giving me a headache.
